uses: Use it as a miniature rake for gardening in small pots or trays.
Turn it upside down and use the tines as hooks to hang jewelry or keys.
Use it as a hair accessory by crafting it into a unique hairpin or comb.
Dip the tines in paint and use it as a stamp to create interesting patterns on paper or fabric.
Use it as a makeshift back scratcher for those hard-to-reach places.
Use it as a tool to carve intricate designs in clay or play-dough.
Fashion it into a stand to prop up your smartphone or tablet for hands-free viewing.
Use it to create designs in a tray of sand for a therapeutic zen garden.
Turn it into a unique piece of jewelry by adding beads or charms to the handle.
Repurpose it as a tool for cleaning hard-to-reach corners or crevices in your home.
